brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective randomized comparison of two widely used in vitro culture system in human IVF
      treatments. In vitro fertilized oocytes and embryos are cultured in individual culture media
      droplets using conventional petridish or in group culture using WOW (well of the well)
      petridish.

      Primary outcome: implantation and pregnancy rates Secondary outcome: fertilization rate and
      embryo quality

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Individual Culture and Group Culture of Preimplantation Embryos in Human IVF Treatments
clinical_study.condition: Other Complications Associated With Artificial Fertilization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Infertile patients entering in vitro fertilization treatment

          -  at least 1 oocyte collected

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  no oocytes collected

study_pop.textblock: Patients entering in vitro fertilization and embryo transfer treatment

intervention.description: Embryos cultured in a 25 microliter droplet of culture media individually in a conventional petridish or in groups of 2-10 embryos in a Well-of-the-Well petridish
intervention.intervention_name: individual embryo culture or group culture

facility.name: Semmelweis University First Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Individual Culture and Group Culture of Preimplantation Embryos in Human IVF Treatments

other_outcome.measure: Time needed for evaluation of zygotes and embryos

overall_official.affiliation: Semmelweis University First Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology

Semmelweis University First Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology

primary_outcome.description: Number of clinical pregnancies (/No. of embryo transfers)
Number of embryos implanted (/number of embryos transferred)

secondary_outcome.description: Number of oocytes fertilized. (only in intracytoplasmic sperm injection  cycles)
Number and quality of blastomeres, amount of fragmentation embryo grade
